intro: Centaurium micranthum, commonly known as the small-flower centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family, characterized by its showy, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soil. Its small, lance-shaped leaves are arranged in opposite pairs along the stem. Centaurium micranthum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
